intro: Seseli corymbosum, commonly known as clustered seseli, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in dry, rocky soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its aromatic foliage and showy inflorescence make it a notable species in botanical gardens and natural areas.
